lines.text: Aha!
You got something?
This <c=#0000FF>Living Memory</c> spell... a Stop Wizard could use it to project an image of the body before he died!
That'd be a pretty easy way to identify him, right?
Sure, but we don't exactly have a Stop Wizard available.
Plus, I don't know if I'd want to authorize them to cast spells even if we did.
...No, right, but what I'm saying is, what if they <c=#FF00FF>already did?</c>
Like, that hologram right over there.
Where that hologram came from is a <c=#FF00FF>different question.</c> Maybe try and draw that connection separately.
Still, maybe you're onto something with that <c=#FF00FF>hologram</c> thing...
Not that I know who that is in the hologram... maybe I should <c=#FF00FF>take a closer look.</c>
I mean... you really don't know who the dead guy is? He's burnt up, but...
Hm? Who do you think it is?
I mean it's gotta be Slick Emmup, right? The guy in the hologram?
He looks... exactly the same, is the thing.
You'd think that, wouldn't you? But think again, kid.
The body's burnt to a crisp, see? When the corpse is burnt, you can't identify it.
But- look! He's wearing the same clothes! He's the same height! It's him!
You don't know that. What if it's someone else, and they just switched his clothes?
Why would they- you're saying they disguised a different body as Slick Emmup, then burnt him alive?
Criminals are sneaky, kid.
And they just had Slick's clothes lying around because...?
Shouldn't I be asking you that question? Figure it out!
I'm not gonna figure out the secret underlying cause ofâ€¦
a wild guess
that you just made up
with no evidence
just to make things more exciting, man.
Can we just, for one minute, entertain the wild theory that this guy who looks exactly like the deceased, is actually the freaking deceased?
Bah. Fine. Suck all the fun out of my job, why don't you?
(Although... I probably am going to run into some convoluted junk like that, eventually.)
